subject: Education
title: When Coding Entered the Curriculum
description: One-minute skill: When Coding Entered the Curriculum.

hook.text: Estonia taught coding in first grade in 2012. A decade later, most countries still debate whether to try.

buildup.text: The 'learn to code' movement argues programming is as fundamental as reading and math.

discovery.text: Coding teaches computational thinkingâ€”breaking problems down, recognizing patterns, building solutions.

twist.text: Most coding curricula teach syntax, not thinkingâ€”students memorize commands without grasping logic.

climax.text: Countries succeeding teach problem-solving through code, not code for its own sake.

punchline.text: The goal isn't making everyone a programmer. It's making everyone a thinker.

quiz.question: What is the primary goal of teaching coding in schools?
